Arch. § 413.—</sense><sense id="n501.1" n="II" level="1"> As an appellative, <hi rend="ital">a nandsome and powerful man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 11</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăchillēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">*)axi/lleios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Achilles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis Achilleae fastus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae,</quote> <trans><tr>statues like Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: cothurnus, <hi rend="ital">the lofty and grave tragic style</hi> (since Achilles was a hero of the early epos and drama): <cit><quote lang="la">Achilleo conponere verba cothurno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:32:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 32, 41</bibl></cit> (Aeschyleo, Müller).—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăchil-lĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, Ven. 7, 8, 63.</sense></entryFree>
achillides: <entryFree id="n502" type="main" key="A^chilli_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăchillīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">patron. m.</hi> (more correct than Achilleides), = <foreign lang="greek">*)axillei/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a descendant of Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
achivus: <entryFree id="n503" type="main" key="A^chi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăchīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> Achivom, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 266</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fr. Achaeus, with the Digamma, Achaefos, Achifus, Achivus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">Achaean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi> (v. Achaia): <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăchīvi</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the Greeks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14</bibl>: quidquid delirant reges plectuntur Achivi, <hi rend="ital">whatever wrongs the</hi> (Grecian) <hi rend="ital">kings are guilty of</hi> (before Troy) <hi rend="ital">their subjects must suffer for;</hi> but it soon became a general proverb: <hi rend="ital">whatever errors the great commit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the people must atone for</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
achlis: <entryFree id="n504" type="main" key="achlis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">achlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild beast of the North</hi>, which modern naturalists consider to be the same as the <hi rend="ital">alces.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> achlin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 16, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acholla: <entryFree id="n505" type="main" key="A^cholla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcholla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (also Achilla), <sense id="n505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of Thapsus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">El-Aliah</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 33.</sense></entryFree>
achor: <entryFree id="n506" type="greek" key="a^chor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăchor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)xw/r</foreign>, <sense id="n506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scald</hi> on the head, Macer. de Ruta, 1, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
achradina: <entryFree id="n507" type="main" key="Achra^di_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Achrădīna</orth>, <itype>or Acradina, ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of the city of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
achras: <entryFree id="n508" type="greek" key="achras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">achras</orth>, <itype>ădis and ădos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)xra/s</foreign>, <sense id="n508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild pear-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:15:250" default="NO">10, 15, 250</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acia: <entryFree id="n509" type="main" key="a^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. acus</etym>, <sense id="n509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thread for sewing</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">r(a/mma</foreign>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 3, 21</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Rel. p. 115</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acicula: <entryFree id="n510" type="hapax" key="a^ci^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small pin for a head-dress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1004, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acidalia: <entryFree id="n511" type="main" key="A^ci_da^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcīdălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)akidali/a</foreign>, <sense id="n511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Venus</hi>, perhaps from the Fountain Acidalius, in Boeotia, where the Graces, daughters of Venus, used to bathe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 720</bibl> Serv.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcīdălĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Venus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludit Acidalio nodo,</quote> <trans><tr>with the girdle of Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 14</bibl></cit>: ales, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a dove</hi>, Carm. ad Pis. 79.</sense></entryFree>
acide: <entryFree id="n512" type="main" key="a^ci^de"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭde</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. acidus <sense id="n512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aciditas: <entryFree id="n513" type="hapax" key="a^ci^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acidus</etym>, <sense id="n513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sourness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acidity</hi>: stomachi, Marcell. Emp. 20.</sense></entryFree>
acidulus: <entryFree id="n514" type="main" key="a^ci^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, dim. [acidus], <sense id="n514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little sour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acidulous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>mineral water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 230</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 5, § 9</bibl>; so, fons, ib.</sense></entryFree>
acidus: <entryFree id="n515" type="main" key="a^ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aceo</etym>, <sense id="n515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n515.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 27, 32, § 106</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">sorba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 36, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:34:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 9, 34, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acidissumum acetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n515.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n515.3" n="1" level="3"> Like acer, from taste to sound, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus acidior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">canticum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n515.4" n="2" level="3"> Acida creta, <hi rend="ital">chalk steeped in vinegar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:93" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n515.5" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pungent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo acidae linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod petis, id sane est invisum acidumque duobus,</quote> <trans><tr>unpleasant</tr>, <tr>disagreeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭde</orth>, <hi rend="ital">bitterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non acide feras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi acidius fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:92" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acieris: <entryFree id="n516" type="gloss" key="a^ci^e_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭēris</orth>, is <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acies</etym>, “securis aerea, qua in sacrificiis utebantur sacerdotes,” Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 10</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
acies: <entryFree id="n517" type="main" key="a^ci^e_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭēs</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. 2. acer</etym> (<sense id="n517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> acii and <pb n="23" /> <cb n="ACIE" /> acie, like dii and die, facii and facie, fr. dies, facies, Cn. Mat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl>; Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 208</bibl>, or Sall. Fragm. ed. Kritz. p. 118; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 780</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">a sharp edge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">point.</hi> </sense><sense id="n517.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of a sword, dagger, sickle, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 11, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">securium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n517.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n517.3" n="1" level="3"> Of the sense or faculty of sight, </sense><sense id="n517.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Keenness of look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharpness of vision</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>: oculorum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 34, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 324</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also acies alone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 420</bibl></cit>; and in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 693</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vultum quidem atque aciem oculorum ferre potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupula ad te dirigit aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta tenuitas, ut fugiat aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum incolumis acies, misera caecitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:558 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 558 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n517.5" n="b" level="4"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the pupil of the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 411</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with 414: acies ipsa, quā cernimus, quae pupula vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Albania gigni quosdam glaucā oculorum acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. ib.: glaucis oculis); and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> (as pars pro toto) for <hi rend="ital">the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:249" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:281" default="NO" valid="yes">281</bibl>; 358; <cit><quote lang="la">720: huc geminas nunc flecte acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 789</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 658</bibl> (hence the word is also used in the plur., cf. below, 2.).—</sense><sense id="n517.6" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A looking at an object with fixed attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam rem habeo omnem aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—On the contr., prima acie, <hi rend="ital">at the first glance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 448</bibl> (cf. primo aspectu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 98</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n517.7" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">the front of an army</hi> (conceived of as the edge of a sword), <hi rend="ital">line of battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">battle-array.</hi> </sense><sense id="n517.8" n="a" level="4"> In abstr. (cf. Vitr. praef. 1. 7, p. 154 Rod.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ego si aciem exercitus nostri ostendero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem instruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirigere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra aciem procurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit non proeliis, neque in acie, sed alio more bellum gerendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also of the arrangement of ships for a naval engagement,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl>.—Hence, metaph. </sense><sense id="n517.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The battlearray;</hi> in concr., <hi rend="ital">an army drawn up in order of battle</hi>: acies est instructa a nobis decem cohortium, Galba ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium acies cernebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62</bibl></cit>: altera pars acii vitassent fluminis undas, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14</bibl> (as transl. of Il. 21 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">dubitavit acie pars, Sall. Fragm. l. l.: stabit ante aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1</bibl> Par. 12, 33: <cit><quote lang="la">prima acies hastati erant,</quote> <trans><tr>the van</tr>, <tr>the first line</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertiam aciem laborantibus subsidio mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: ab novissima acie, <hi rend="ital">from the rear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante signa procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra acies (= dextrum cornu),</quote> <trans><tr>the right wing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina magis quam acies pugnabant,</quote> <trans><tr>in marching order</tr>, <tr>rather than in order of battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 34</bibl></cit> (acies is here, and in similar cases, considered as the <number>sing.</number> used collectively; v. Oud. and Herz. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62</bibl>; yet the <number>plur.</number> is more than probable). Rarely of cavalry, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: acies Vulcania, of <hi rend="ital">a long line of fire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 408</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n517.10" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The action of the troops drawn up in battlearray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engagement</hi>, = pugna: in acie celebri objectans vitam, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 234, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: mea facta in acie obliti, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 502, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in acie Pharsalica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in acie vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias in aciem ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">producere in aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excedere acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">direxerunt aciem contra eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 14, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl> Par. 18, 33.—</sense><sense id="n517.11" n="3" level="3"> Acies ferri, <hi rend="ital">steel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n517.12" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sheen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtunsa stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 395</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n517.13" n="II" level="1"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n517.14" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) (like <hi rend="ital">acumen.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">Acuteness of the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharpness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi> (so very often in Cicero, but always with the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> mentis, animi, ingenii): <cit><quote lang="la">(cum animus) exacuerit illam, ut oculorum, sic ingenii aciem ad bona eligenda, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 60</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum diversitas aciem intentionis abrumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prol., § 3.— </sense><sense id="n517.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A verbal contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discussion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis aciem contra conferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: ad philosophos me revocas, qui in aciem non saepe prodeunt,<cb n="ACON" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos jam in aciem dimicationemque veniamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:17" default="NO">6, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:29" default="NO">10, 1, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acilianus: <entryFree id="n518" type="main" key="A^ci_li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcīlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to Acilius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annales,</quote> <trans><tr>the annals of C. Acilius Glabrio</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acilius: <entryFree id="n519" type="main" key="A^ci_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcīlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several Romans</hi>, among whom was <hi rend="ital">M' Acilius Glabrio</hi>, trib. pleb., by whom the severe law <hi rend="ital">de pecuniis repetundis</hi> was introduced, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9</bibl> and 17.—C. Acilius Glabrio, <hi rend="ital">the historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 32, 115</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Acilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acina: <entryFree id="n520" type="main" key="a^ci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭna</orth>, v. acinns.</entryFree>
acinaces: <entryFree id="n521" type="greek" key="a^ci_na^ce_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcīnăcēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kina/khs</foreign>, <sense id="n521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the short sabre of the Persians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Medes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Scythians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scimitar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:17 al" default="NO">4, 15, 17 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
acinarius: <entryFree id="n522" type="hapax" key="a^ci^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>acinus</etym>, <sense id="n522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the grape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <trans><tr>vessels for holding grapes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acinatius: <entryFree id="n523" type="main" key="a^ci^na_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭnātĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prepared from grapes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>made from dried grapes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acinos: <entryFree id="n524" type="greek" key="a^ci^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/kinos</foreign>, <sense id="n524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fragrant plant</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">wild basil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 27, 101, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acinosus: <entryFree id="n525" type="main" key="a^ci^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>acinus</etym>, <sense id="n525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">similar to grapes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 27, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 17, 68, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acinus: <entryFree id="n526" type="main" key="a^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, partic. in <number>plur.</number> acina, orum (also <itype>ăcĭna, ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 4</bibl>). <sense id="n526.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A berry</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">the grape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:60" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 60</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: hederae sambucique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:100 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 29, § 100 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cissanthemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 25, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligustri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 24, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trychni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 21, § 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n526.1" n="II" level="1"> Per meton., <hi rend="ital">the stone of a berry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acionna: <entryFree id="n527" type="gloss" key="Acionna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acionna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic deity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1955</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acipenser: <entryFree id="n528" type="main" key="a^ci^penser"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭpenser</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcĭpensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (also aquip., not accipenser), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kki^phsi/os</foreign>, <sense id="n528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish very highly esteemed in the age of the greatest luxury of the Romans</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the sturgeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:132" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acis: <entryFree id="n529" type="main" key="A_cis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ācis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)=akis</foreign>, <sense id="n529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which rises in Mount Aetna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and falls into the sea;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Fiume di Taci</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:468" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 468</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:221" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 221</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 332 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n529.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river-god</hi>, acc. to the myth, <hi rend="ital">son of Faunus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved by Galatea on account of his beauty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:750 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 750 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n530" type="main" key="Acis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclades</hi>, i. q. Siphnus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acisco: <entryFree id="n531" type="main" key="a^cisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, i. q., acesco, Garg. Mart. ap. Maj. Auct. Class. 3, p. 419.</entryFree>
acisculus: <entryFree id="n532" type="gloss" key="a^ciscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăciscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. ascia, and so more prop. asciculus</etym>, <sense id="n532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little adze</hi>, Isid. Gloss.—</sense><sense id="n532.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">As a surname</hi>, Quint, 6, 3, 53.‡ “<orth extent="full" lang="la">ăciscŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>acisculus</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">lato/mos</foreign>” (<hi rend="ital">stone-cutter</hi>), Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
aclassis: <entryFree id="n533" type="gloss" key="aclassis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aclassis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, “tunica ab humeris non consuta,” Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 20</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
aclys: <entryFree id="n534" type="main" key="aclys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aclys</orth>, <itype>ydis</itype> (better than aclis), = <foreign lang="greek">a)gkuli/s</foreign> (first used by Verg.), <sense id="n534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small javelin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 730</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:33:362 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 33, 362 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 554, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acmon: <entryFree id="n535" type="main" key="Acmo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acmōn</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n535.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Aeneas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acmon Lyrnessius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n535.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Diomed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 484</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. Acmona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 497</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acmonensis: <entryFree id="n536" type="main" key="Acmo^nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acmŏnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to Acmonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a town of Phrygia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 106</bibl></sense></entryFree>
acmonides: <entryFree id="n537" type="main" key="Acmo^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acmŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Vulcan's workmen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:288" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 288</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acnua: <entryFree id="n538" type="main" key="acnu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acnŭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">acna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)/kena</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">a)/kaina</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">piece of land</hi>, 120 <hi rend="ital">feet square</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 15, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acoenonetus: <entryFree id="n539" type="main" key="a^coeno_ne_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcoenōnētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n539.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr></sense></entryFree>
acoenonoetus: <entryFree id="n540" type="greek" key="a^coeno^no^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcoenŏnŏētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)koinono/htos</foreign>, <sense id="n540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has not common-sense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:218" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 218</bibl>: communi carens seusu, Schol. ad h. 1. (Herm. and Rib.; but Jahn and Mayor here read <foreign lang="greek">a)koinw/nhtos</foreign> (in Greek letters); perh. <hi rend="ital">not sharing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">selfish</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
acoetis: <entryFree id="n541" type="greek" key="a^coetis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcoetis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/koitis</foreign>, <sense id="n541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bed-fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wife</hi>: Amphitryonis, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 26, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aconae: <entryFree id="n542" type="greek" key="a^co^nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŏnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ko/nai</foreign>, <sense id="n542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointed stones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudae cautes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 3, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aconiti: <entryFree id="n543" type="greek" key="a^co^ni_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŏnīti</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)koniti/</foreign>, <sense id="n543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without labor</hi><cb n="ACQU" />  (lit. <hi rend="ital">without dust</hi>, the figure taken from the athletae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 51</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aconitum: <entryFree id="n544" type="greek" key="a^co^ni_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŏnītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ko/niton</foreign>, <sense id="n544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poisonous plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wolf's-bane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monk's-hood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aconite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aconiton,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 407</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 419</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 322</bibl>. —For <hi rend="ital">a strong poison</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acontias: <entryFree id="n545" type="greek" key="a^conti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcontĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)konti/as</foreign>. <sense id="n545.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A quick-darting serpent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 27</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n545.1" n="II" level="1"> In <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcontĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)konti/ai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">meteors</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shooting-stars with dartlike trains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acontius: <entryFree id="n546" type="main" key="A^conti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcontĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n546.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lover of Cydippe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Her. 20, 239</bibl>, and 21, 229.—</sense><sense id="n546.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Boeotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acontizo: <entryFree id="n547" type="greek" key="a^conti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcontīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)konti/zw</foreign>, lit., <sense id="n547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shoot a dart;</hi> hence, intrans. of blood, <hi rend="ital">to spout</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gush forth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 26</bibl> and 27.</sense></entryFree>
acontizomenos: <entryFree id="n548" type="greek" key="A^conti_zo^me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcontīzŏmĕnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)akontizo/menos</foreign> (struck with a dart), <sense id="n548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy of Naevius</hi>, see the fragment in, R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Rel. p. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acopos: <entryFree id="n549" type="greek" key="a^co^pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŏpos</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcōpon</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/kopos</foreign> (removing weariness, pain, etc.). <sense id="n549.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of stone</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">crystalline quartz</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 143</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n549.1" n="II" level="1"> <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant useful in childbirth</hi>, also called <hi rend="ital">anagyros</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n549.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aco-pum</orth> (sc. medicamentum or unguentum), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a soothing salve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:3:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3, 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
acor: <entryFree id="n550" type="main" key="a^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aceo</etym>, <sense id="n550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sour taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sourness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n550.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO">7, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:41:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 11, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of meat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n550.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig. hortor ut jucundissimum genus vitae nonnullis interdum quasi acoribus condias, i. e. <hi rend="ital">excitements</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
acorna: <entryFree id="n551" type="greek" key="a^corna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcorna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/korna</foreign>, <sense id="n551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of thistle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acorus: <entryFree id="n552" type="greek" key="a^co^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŏrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/koros</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">a)/koron</foreign>, <sense id="n552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an aromatic plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjectured by some to be our sweet-flag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calamus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:157 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 100, § 157 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:28" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 5, 15, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 23 al.</bibl> In the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">acoros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acquiesco: <entryFree id="n553" type="main" key="acqui^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ac-quĭesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adqu.</orth>), <itype>ēvi, ētum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, lit., <sense id="n553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become</hi> physically <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi> physical <hi rend="ital">repose;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to repose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rest</hi> (freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n553.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sine respirem, quaeso. <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Immo adquiesce, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitandi caloris causā Lanuvii trīs horas acquieveram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a lassitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravi sopore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 10, 6</bibl></cit>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> of sleep, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aures extremum semper exspectent in eoque acquiescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59</bibl></cit>.—By euphemism (as in all languages), <hi rend="ital">to die</hi> (esp. after a wearisome life): <cit><quote lang="la">sic vir fortissimus multis variisque perfunctus laboribus, anno acquievit septuagesimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 64</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in many epitaphs: HIC ADQVIESCIT, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2313</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4084</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4491 al.</bibl>; so, quiesco, q. v.</sense><sense id="n553.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n553.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To come to a state of repose in relation to one's wishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desires</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to repose in; to find rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasure</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">in; to rejoice in;</hi> in Cic. mostly with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, and of things: in the historians and later writers, with <case>dat.</case> or <case>abl.</case>, and also of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quae delectet, in qua acquiescam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes in adulescentium caritate acquiescimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jam aetate provecti in nostris libris acquiescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>. Examples in Cic. of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum ut quasi loquerer, in quo uno acquiesco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 9, 10</bibl></cit>, and with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui maxime P. Clodii morte acquierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Mil. 37:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mil. 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui velut oraculo acquiescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno solatio acquiescens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cal. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos elegit, quibus etiam post eum principes acquieverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n553.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be satisfied with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acquiesce in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give assent to</hi>: tu, cum es commotus, acquiescis, assentiris, approbas (where the climax of the ideas should be noticed, <hi rend="ital">you accede to them</hi>, i. e. you cease to oppose them; <hi rend="ital">you assent to them</hi>, i. e. you make known your approbation by words), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 46, 141</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:22:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 22, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:7 al" default="NO">38, 1, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
acquiro: <entryFree id="n554" type="main" key="acqui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ac-quīro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adqu.</orth>), <itype>sīvi, sītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quaero</etym>, <sense id="n554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to add to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi> (in <pb n="24" /> <cb n="ACRI" /> addition), with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <case>dat.</case> (freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n554.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi quidem ipsi, quid est quod ad vitae fructum possit acquiri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides quam omnis gratias non modo retinendas, sed etiam acquirendas putemus,</quote> <trans><tr>but even new favor is to be acquired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 6</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: viresque adquirit eundo, <hi rend="ital">and gains</hi> (ever new and greater) <hi rend="ital">strength in her course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 175</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n554.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n554.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad usum vitae pertineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adquirere pauca (sc. nova verba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n554.4" n="B" level="2"> In later Lat., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acquire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amass riches</hi> or <hi rend="ital">money</hi> (cf.: quaero, quaestus; <cit><quote lang="la">abundo, abundantia) [mox adquirendi docet insatiabile votum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 125</bibl></cit>]: <cit><quote lang="la">acquirendi ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acquisitio: <entryFree id="n555" type="main" key="acqui_si_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acquīsītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acquiro</etym>, <sense id="n555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acquisition.</hi> </sense><sense id="n555.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In abstr.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:4:section=31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 4, 4, § 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exh. Cast. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n555.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Concr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accession</hi>, Frontin. Aquaed. 10; 69 sq.</sense></entryFree>
acra: <entryFree id="n556" type="greek" key="acra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, also <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/kra</foreign>, <sense id="n556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">headland</hi>, App. de Mundo prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">Acra Iapygia,</quote> <trans><tr>a promontory in Magna Graecia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acrae: <entryFree id="n557" type="main" key="Acrae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/akrai</foreign>. <sense id="n557.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on a lofty hill near Syracuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now Palazzolo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:206" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 206</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n557.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in the Chersonesus Taurica</hi> (Crimea), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acraephia: <entryFree id="n558" type="main" key="Acraephi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acraephĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*)akraifi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Boeotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now Kardhiza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 12, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acraeus: <entryFree id="n559" type="greek" key="Acraeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)krai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dwelling on the heights; an epithet of Jupiter and of Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose temples stood on heights</hi>, Liv 38, 2; 32, 23.</sense></entryFree>
acragas: <entryFree id="n560" type="main" key="A^cra^ga_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcrăgās</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*)akra/gas</foreign> (<case>acc.</case> Gr. Acraganta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:475" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 475</bibl>), <sense id="n560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain on the S. W. coast of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a city upon it;</hi> the city was also called Agrigentum, now <hi rend="ital">Girgenti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 703</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl> (v. Agrigentum); <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the philosopher Empedocles</hi>, who was hence called <hi rend="ital">Acragantinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 716</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n561" type="main" key="Acra^gas2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acrăgas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated graver</hi> (caelator), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acratophorum: <entryFree id="n562" type="greek" key="a^cra_to^pho^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcrātŏphŏrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kratofo/ron</foreign>, <sense id="n562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a pitcher</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flask</hi>) <hi rend="ital">for holding unmixed wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acre: <entryFree id="n563" type="main" key="a_cre"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācre</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. acer <sense id="n563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
acredo: <entryFree id="n564" type="main" key="a_cre_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fr. 2. acer, as dulcedo fr. dulcis</etym>, <sense id="n564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pungent taste</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 15, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acredula: <entryFree id="n565" type="main" key="a_^cre_du^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^crēdŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an unknown bird</hi>, by which Cic. translates the <foreign lang="greek">o)lolugw/n</foreign> of Aratus, Div. 1, 8, 14; acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">the thrush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the owl</hi>, Auct. Carm. Phil. 15.</sense></entryFree>
acriae: <entryFree id="n566" type="main" key="Acri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*)akriai/</foreign>, <sense id="n566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Laconia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 27, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acriculus: <entryFree id="n567" type="main" key="a_cri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [2. acer], <hi rend="ital">somewhat sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille acriculus senex Zeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 38</bibl></cit> (cf. acerbus, and the passage there quoted fr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
acridium: <entryFree id="n568" type="main" key="a_cridi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācridĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the</hi> scammonia, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acrifolium: <entryFree id="n569" type="main" key="a_cri^fo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrĭfŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. acer + folium</etym>, <sense id="n569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown tree of ill omen</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acrillae: <entryFree id="n570" type="main" key="Acrillae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acrillae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the road from Syracuse to Agrigentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 35, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acrimonia: <entryFree id="n571" type="main" key="a_cri^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrĭmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. acer</etym>, <sense id="n571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sharpness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pungency</hi> (so far as it has a quickening, animating power, diff. fr. <hi rend="ital">acerbitas</hi>, which desig. a disagreeable sharpness). </sense><sense id="n571.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of taste: <cit><quote lang="la">si ulcus acrimoniam brassicae ferre non poterit,</quote> <trans><tr>the pungency</tr>, <tr>irritation</tr>, <tr>smart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:5" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis cum quadam acrimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 78, § 128</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sinapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:128 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 128 al.</bibl></cit>—Of smell, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n571.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">sharpness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acrimony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austerity</hi> of character, <hi rend="ital">energy</hi> of acting: “animi vivacitas,” <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 73, 17</bibl>: mei feri ingeri iram atque animi acrem acrimoniam, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 73, 18</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 11</bibl>); cf.: vim, ferociam, animi, atrocitatem, iram, acrimoniam, Att. <cb n="ACRO" /> ib. (Ribbeck, p. 196): <cit><quote lang="la">convenit in vultu pudorem et acrimoniam esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 13, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Glabrionis patris vim et acrimoniam ceperis ad resistendum hominibus audacissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 52</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">vis et acrimonia causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:48:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 48, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 37, 49</bibl></cit>.—Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">sharpness</hi> of speech (opp. sermo): <cit><quote lang="la">tum in sermone, tum in acrimonia,</quote> <trans><tr>now in common conversation</tr>, <tr>now in sharp talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 42, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acrisione: <entryFree id="n572" type="main" key="A_cri^si^o_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ācrĭsĭōnē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*)akrisiw/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Acrisius</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Danaë</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 11, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acrisioneus: <entryFree id="n573" type="main" key="A_cri^si^o_ne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ācrĭsĭōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to Acrisius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Argos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ardea</tr>, <tr>built by Danaë</tr>, <tr>the daughter of Acrisius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:661" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 661</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 410</bibl></cit> (where some improperly refer it to <hi rend="ital">Danaë</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
acrisioniades: <entryFree id="n574" type="main" key="A_cri^si^o_ni^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ācrĭsĭōnĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">patron.</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">*)akrisiwnia/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a descendant of Acrisius</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Perseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Danaë</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acrisius: <entryFree id="n575" type="main" key="A_cri^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ācrĭsĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*)akri/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">King of Argos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Abas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Danaë;</hi> unintentionally killed by his grandson, Perseus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:608 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 608 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 372</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
acritas: <entryFree id="n576" type="main" key="a_cri^tas1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. acer</etym>, i. q. <sense id="n576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acritudo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 3, 2</bibl>: vis veritatis atque acritas, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 493, 14</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 196</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n577" type="main" key="A_cri_ta_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ācrītās</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*)akri/tas</foreign>, <sense id="n577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the most southerly promontory in Messenia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capo di Gallo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO">2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 7, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acriter: <entryFree id="n578" type="main" key="a_cri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. acer <sense id="n578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
acritudo: <entryFree id="n579" type="main" key="a_cri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. acer</etym>, <sense id="n579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of</hi> acer, <hi rend="ital">sharpness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n579.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of a fluid, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 3, 18</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n579.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n579.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Liveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigor et acritudo populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 27</bibl></cit>: haut quisquam potis est tolerare acritudinem, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll. (R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:Trag. Rel. p. 196" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 196</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n579.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Harshness</hi> of character: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 224</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acro: <entryFree id="n580" type="greek" key="acro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acro</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">acrōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/krwn</foreign>, <sense id="n580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the extremity of a thing;</hi> so <hi rend="ital">of a member of the body</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 28, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 65, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of the stem of a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acroama: <entryFree id="n581" type="greek" key="a_cro^a_ma^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrŏāmă</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kro/ama</foreign>.— Prop., <sense id="n581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is heard</hi> with pleasure, <hi rend="ital">a gratification to the ear;</hi> as music or reading; esp. used for entertainment at meals, with <hi rend="ital">music</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reading</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl>; Petron. Fragm. Tragun. p. 297.—Hence, meton. (like the <number>plur.</number> in Greek), <hi rend="ital">the entertainer at table</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by music</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a performer</hi>) or <hi rend="ital">by reading</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a reader</hi>); also <hi rend="ital">a buffoon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex Themistocle quaererctur, quod acroama aut cujus vocem lubentissime audiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo in convivio ejus (Attici) aliud acroama audivit, quam anagnosten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum spectator, sed actor et acroama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>. Cf. Smith's Antiq., and Becker's Gall. 3, p. 203 (2d ed.).</sense></entryFree>
acroamatarius: <entryFree id="n582" type="greek" key="a_cro^a_ma^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrŏāmătārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>acroama</etym>, <sense id="n582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a musical</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reading entertainment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SER. ACROAMAT. GRAEC., i. e. serva acroamataria Graeca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2885</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acroamaticus: <entryFree id="n583" type="main" key="a_cro^a_ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrŏāmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, read in the old edd. of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5</bibl>, where the MSS. give, in the same sense, <sense id="n583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acroaticus</hi>, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
acroasis: <entryFree id="n584" type="greek" key="a_cro^a_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrŏāsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kro/asis</foreign> (<sense id="n584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a listening to</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the discourse delivered before an assembly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public lecture</hi> (cf. the use of <hi rend="ital">contio</hi> among Eng. and <hi rend="ital">collegium</hi> among Germ. scholars, for <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut eas vel in acroasi audeam legere,</quote> <trans><tr>in a public lecture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Callias acroasin fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimas acroases fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 2</bibl></cit> (al. <foreign lang="greek">a)kroa/seis</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
acroaticus: <entryFree id="n585" type="greek" key="a_cro^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācrŏātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kroatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">designed for hearing only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esoteric</hi> (opp. <foreign lang="greek">e)cwteriko/s</foreign>), in the Aristotelian philosophy, acc. to the interpreters, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acroceraunia: <entryFree id="n586" type="main" key="A_cro^ce^rauni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ācrŏcĕraunĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/kris</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">kerauno/s</foreign>; pr. Thunder-Heights</etym>, <sense id="n586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very rocky promontory in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">running out into the Ionian Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Glossa</hi>, called by the Italians <hi rend="ital">Linguetta</hi> (the mountain to which it belongs was called Ceraunii <cb n="ACTE" /> montes or Ceraunia; <cit><quote lang="la">see this art.): infamīs scopulos Acroceraunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same in sing.: promontorium Acroceraunium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 97</bibl></cit>; for <hi rend="ital">any dangerous place</hi>: haec tibi sint Syrtes; <cit><quote lang="la">haec Acroceraunia vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 739</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
