acrochordon: <entryFree id="n587" type="greek" key="a^cro^chordon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcrŏchordon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kroxordw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acrocolefium: <entryFree id="n588" type="greek" key="acro^co_le_fi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acrŏcōlēfĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)krokwlh/fion</foreign>, <sense id="n588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the upper part of the foot of a swine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acrocolion: <entryFree id="n589" type="main" key="acro^co_li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acrŏcōlĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)krokw/lion</foreign>, i. q. acro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 47, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
acrocorinthus: <entryFree id="n590" type="main" key="A_cro^co^rinthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ācrŏcŏrinthus</orth> (-us), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*)akroko/rinqos</foreign>, <sense id="n590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the citadel of Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated on a height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which the two seas could be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Aegean and Ionian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 50, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:106" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acrocorium: <entryFree id="n591" type="main" key="acro^co^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acrŏcŏrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of onion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acrolithus: <entryFree id="n592" type="greek" key="acro^li^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acrŏlĭthus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kro/liqos</foreign> (of stone at the extremity): statuae, <sense id="n592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">statues whose extremities only consisted of marble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the remainder of wood</hi>, Treb. Poll. XXX. Tyr. c. 32 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl> written as Greek); cf. Müll. Arch. § 48, 1; Winckelm. Hist. Art. 1, 2, 17.</sense></entryFree>
acron: <entryFree id="n593" type="main" key="A_cron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ācron</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n593.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Caeninenses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the war with the Romans on account of the rape of the Sabines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was slain by Romulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n593.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek slain by Mezentius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 719</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n593.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Helenius Acron</hi>, a commentator on Terence, Horace, and perh. Persius; cf. Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> II. § 370.</sense></entryFree>
acronius: <entryFree id="n594" type="main" key="Acro_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acrōnĭus lacus</orth>, <sense id="n594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of Lake Constance</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Ueberlingen Lake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acronoma: <entryFree id="n595" type="main" key="Acro^no^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acrŏnŏma saxa</orth>, <sense id="n595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown place in Lower Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 40, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acropodium: <entryFree id="n596" type="main" key="a^cro^po^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcrŏpŏdĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)/kros</foreign>, extreme, and <foreign lang="greek">pou/s</foreign>, foot</etym>, <sense id="n596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pedestal of a statue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 88" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acror: <entryFree id="n597" type="main" key="a_cror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ācror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. acer</etym>, = acritudo, Fulg. Cont. Verg. <sense id="n597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
acrota: <entryFree id="n598" type="main" key="Acro^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Acrŏta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">king of the Albani</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Romulus Silvius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 617</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acroteria: <entryFree id="n599" type="greek" key="a^cro_te_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcrōtērĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)krwth/ria</foreign>, <sense id="n599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the projecting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extreme part of a thing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n599.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of a harbor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n599.2" n="II" level="1"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">the projecting parts of a pediment</hi>, serving as a support for figures or statues, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 5, 12 sq.</bibl>; cf. Müll. Arch. § 284.</sense></entryFree>
acrozymus: <entryFree id="n600" type="greek" key="acro_zy_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acrōzȳmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kro/zumos</foreign>, <sense id="n600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slightly leavened</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Or. 20, 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acta: <entryFree id="n601" type="main" key="acta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kth/</foreign>, <sense id="n601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sea-shore</hi>, as place of resort: <cit><quote lang="la">in acta jacebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:613 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 613 al.</bibl> (perh. also in <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 13</bibl>; v. Sillig. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n602" type="main" key="acta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">acta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. <itype>ago</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
actaea: <entryFree id="n603" type="main" key="actaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strong - smelling plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herb Christopher</hi>, Actaea spicata, Linn., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 26, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actaeon: <entryFree id="n604" type="main" key="Actaeo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actaeōn</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*)aktai/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grandson of Cadmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having seen Diana bathing naked with her nymphs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was torn to pieces by his own dogs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:230 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 230 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 181 al" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 181 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
actaeus: <entryFree id="n605" type="main" key="Actaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">*)aktai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Attic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Athenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Actaeo Aracyntho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 24</bibl></cit> (as being on the border of Attica): <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <trans><tr>of Athens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 720</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Clytos and Butes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel Hymetti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:386" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <trans><tr>a rain of honey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:453" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 453</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Actaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 1</bibl>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Actaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female Athenian; of Orithyia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 711</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actarius: <entryFree id="n606" type="main" key="acta_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. actuarius.</entryFree>
acte: <entryFree id="n607" type="main" key="acte_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)kth=</foreign>, <sense id="n607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. = ebulum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 73, § 120</bibl>; Ap. Herb. 91.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n608" type="main" key="Acte_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)akth/</foreign>. <sense id="n608.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">coastland</hi> or <hi rend="ital">maritime country;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">the earlier name for Attica</hi>, the province of Middle Greece, in which Athens was situated, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n608.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Horae</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 183</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n608.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A concubine<pb n="25" /> <cb n="ACTI" />  of Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 735</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2885</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actiacus: <entryFree id="n609" type="main" key="Acti^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Actium</etym>, <sense id="n609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to Actium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <trans><tr>at Actium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>the games which Augustus revived at Actium in honor of his victory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus, who had a temple here,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <trans><tr>which had fought at Actium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
actias: <entryFree id="n610" type="main" key="Acti^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n610.0" n="I" level="1"> [Acte.] <hi rend="ital">Attic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Athenian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 463</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n610.1" n="II" level="1"> [Actium.] <hi rend="ital">Of Actium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cleopatra,</quote> <trans><tr>conquered at Actium by Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:120" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
actinophoroe: <entryFree id="n611" type="greek" key="acti_no^pho^roe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actīnŏphŏroe</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos> (Gr. <sense id="n611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi>), = <foreign lang="greek">a)ktinofo/roi</foreign> (bearing rays), <hi rend="ital">epithet of the</hi> cochloe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 147</bibl>, v. Jan ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
actinosus: <entryFree id="n612" type="main" key="acti_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)kti/s</foreign>; pr. full of rays, hence</etym>, <sense id="n612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
actio: <entryFree id="n613" type="main" key="acti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ago</etym>, <sense id="n613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n613.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo deos spoliat motu et actione divina, sed etiam homines inertes efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis laus omnis in actione consistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eas res parandas, quibus actio vitae continetur,</quote> <trans><tr>active</tr>, <tr>practical life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">object. gen.</hi>: itaque nec actio rerum illarum (<hi rend="ital">the public performance of those things</hi>) apertā petulantiā vacat, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio ullius rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 108</bibl></cit>; and so <number>plur.</number>: periculosae rerum actiones sunt, Off. 1, 2, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: actio gratiarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the giving of thanks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 19</bibl></cit> (cf.: gratias agere).—</sense><sense id="n613.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n613.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Public functions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civil acts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceedings</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">duties.</hi> </sense><sense id="n613.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunorum,</quote> <trans><tr>their official duties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 55 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones nostras scriptis mandamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl>.—Hence <hi rend="ital">negotiation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discessu consulum actio de pace sublata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9</bibl></cit>. 9.—Esp. </sense><sense id="n613.5" n="2" level="3"> Of judicial proceedings. </sense><sense id="n613.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">process</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in abstr.</hi>), with a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> more precisely defining it, e. g. actio furti, injuriarum; also with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio de repetundis, de arboribus succisis, etc.: actionem alicui intendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring an action against one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9</bibl></cit>: multis actiones (<hi rend="ital">processes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suits</hi>) et res (<hi rend="ital">the property in suit</hi>) peribant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n613.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The accusation</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in concr.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the statement of the crime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the indictment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accusation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inde illa actio, OPE CONSILIOQVE TVO FVRTVM AIO FACTVM ESSE,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 167</bibl>.—Hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">judicial forms</hi> (the omission of which rendered a suit null and void): actiones Manilianae, <hi rend="ital">forms relative to purchase and sale;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 246</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hostilianae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 57, 245</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n613.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A pleading of a case</hi> (spoken or written); so Cic. calls his Orats. against Verres, actiones, <hi rend="ital">pleas</hi>, simply dividing them into <hi rend="ital">actio prima</hi> and <hi rend="ital">actio secunda</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">actiones litium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Suet. continuae actiones, Ner. 15: in prima parte actionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:20 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 20 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n613.9" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Permission for a suit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare alicui actionem (which was the right or duty of the praetor or judge),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n613.10" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The judicial management of a suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the day of trial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima, altera, tertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n613.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gesticulation connected with oral delivery.</hi> </sense><sense id="n613.12" n="1" level="3"> Of an orator; <hi rend="ital">the exterior air</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delivery</hi>: Demosthenem ferunt ei qui quaesivisset quid primum esset in dicendo, actionem; <cit><quote lang="la">quid secundum, idem et idem tertium respondisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so that it often includes even the voice: actio ejus (Pompeii) habebat et in voce magnum splendorem et in motu summam dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est actio quasi sermo corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 17 al.</bibl>—Hence, also —</sense><sense id="n613.13" n="2" level="3"> Of an actor, <hi rend="ital">action</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo tanta commoveri actio non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n613.14" n="C" level="2"> In dramatic lang., <hi rend="ital">the action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the connection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">series of events</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the plot</hi>, in a play: <cit><quote lang="la">habet enim (fabula) varios actus multasque actiones et consiliorum et temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
actito: <entryFree id="n614" type="main" key="acti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [ago], <hi rend="ital">to act</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be employed in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">much</hi> (only of judicial<cb n="ACTU" />  or dramatic action): <cit><quote lang="la">multas privatas causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragoedias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actium: <entryFree id="n615" type="main" key="Acti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n615.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory and town in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Ambracian Gulf</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">La Punta</hi>), where Augustus conquered Antony and Cleopatra, 31 B. C., and, in commemoration of it, repaired the temple of Apollo, which existed there, and revived the <hi rend="ital">Actian</hi> games, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n615.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A harbor in Corcyra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actiuncula: <entryFree id="n616" type="hapax" key="acti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>actio</etym>, <sense id="n616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short judicial harangue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actius: <entryFree id="n617" type="main" key="Acti^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for Actiacus, <sense id="n617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to Actium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 280</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 675</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">704</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; Phoebus, as having <hi rend="ital">a temple at Actium</hi> (v. Actium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:6:67" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 6, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n618" type="main" key="Acti^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
active: <entryFree id="n619" type="main" key="acti_ve"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actīve</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n619.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
activus: <entryFree id="n620" type="main" key="acti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ago</etym>. <sense id="n620.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Active</hi>: philosophia, <hi rend="ital">practical</hi> (opp. to contemplativa): philosophia et contemplativa est et activa; <cit><quote lang="la">spectat simul agitque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. to spectativus) thesin a causa sic distinguunt, ut illa sit spectativae partis, haec activae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rhetorice) quia maximus ejus usus actu continetur, dicatur activa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n620.1" n="II" level="1"> In gramm.: verba activa, <hi rend="ital">which designate transitive action</hi> (opp. <hi rend="ital">neutra</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intransitiva</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 326</bibl> P. al.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">actīve</orth>, in gramm., <hi rend="ital">actively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like a verb active</hi>, Prisc. pp. 794, 799 P.</sense></entryFree>
actor: <entryFree id="n621" type="main" key="actor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n621.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who drives</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moves something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecoris actor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenae,</quote> <trans><tr>a slinger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:419" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 419</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n621.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">he who does any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a doer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">performer</hi> (cf. ago, II.). </sense><sense id="n621.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. of every kind of action: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illum efficeret oratorem verborum actoremque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 57</bibl></cit> (a translation of the Homer. <foreign lang="greek">prhkth=ra e)/rgwn</foreign>, Il. 9, 443): <cit><quote lang="la">Cato dux, auctor, actor rerum illarum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 3, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n621.3" n="B" level="2"> In judicial lang., <hi rend="ital">one who brings an action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plaintiff</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatorem pro omni actore et petitore appello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. of lawyers: Moloni Rhodio et actori summo causarum et magistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 89 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:369 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 369 al.</bibl>—Also, <hi rend="ital">one who conducts a suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an advocate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caec. 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n621.4" n="C" level="2"> At a later period, <hi rend="ital">an agent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attorney;</hi> in gen., an <hi rend="ital">administrator</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manager</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi> of property or an estate.—So in Tac.: actor publicus, <hi rend="ital">he who administers the public property</hi>, Ann. 2, 30; 3, 67: actor summarum, <hi rend="ital">a keeper of accounts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cashier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl>, and so often in the Dig.: sub actoribus, <hi rend="ital">overseers</hi> (of a household), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n621.5" n="D" level="2"> In rhetor. lang., <hi rend="ital">one who delivers any oral discourse;</hi> and esp. <hi rend="ital">one who delivers an oration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an orator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventor, compositor, actor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n621.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an actor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actores secundarum et tertiarum partium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16</bibl> (cf. ago, II., and actio, II. C.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n622" type="main" key="Actor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, m. <sense id="n622.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Aeneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 500</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n622.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Auruncan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">96</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Actŏ-rĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, patron. <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">son</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grandson of Actor: his son</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Menoetius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 39</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">his grandson</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Patroclus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 273</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">Erithos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 79</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Actŏrĭdae</orth>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Eurytus and Cleatus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sons of Actor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">King of Phthia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:308" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 308</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actorius: <entryFree id="n623" type="main" key="acto_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, i. q. activus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> An. 14</bibl>.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n624" type="main" key="Acto_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Actōrĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
actrix: <entryFree id="n625" type="main" key="actrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>actor</etym>. <sense id="n625.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female plaintiff</hi>, Cod. Th. 7, 16, 41.—</sense><sense id="n625.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stewardess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 913, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actualis: <entryFree id="n626" type="hapax" key="actu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practical</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ac-tŭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">actively</hi>, Myth. Vatic. vol. 3, p. 181 ed. Bod.</sense></entryFree>
actuaria: <entryFree id="n627" type="main" key="actu^a_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. actuarius.</entryFree>
actuariolum: <entryFree id="n628" type="main" key="actu^a_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭārĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>actuarius</etym>, <sense id="n628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift vessel impelled by oars</hi>, <cb n="ACTU" /> <hi rend="ital">row-boat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actuarium: <entryFree id="n629" type="main" key="actu^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <sense id="n629.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr></sense></entryFree>
actuarius: <entryFree id="n630" type="main" key="actu^a_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um., <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ago</etym> <sense id="n630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is</hi> easily <hi rend="ital">moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <trans><tr>a swift sailer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 535, 1</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0646,001:ib. 534:33" default="NO"><author>Sisenn.</author> ib. 534, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: “actuariae naves sunt, quae velis simul et remis aguntur,” <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Or. 19, 1, 24</bibl>: also, <hi rend="ital">abs.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭāria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭārium</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25</bibl>: limes, <hi rend="ital">a road</hi> 12 <hi rend="ital">feet wide between fields</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Lim. p. 151" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Lim. p. 151</bibl>: canes, <hi rend="ital">hunting-dogs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hounds</hi>, acc. to Vel. Long. 2234 P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n631" type="main" key="actu^a_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype> (written by some <sense id="n631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">actarius</hi>, to distinguish it from the preceding, Vel. Long. 2234 P., and so found in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 260</bibl>; ap. Henzen, 6284), sc. <itype>scriba</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. actus, II. B. 1.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n631.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A short-hand writer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 33:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 33, 9</bibl>; cf. Lips. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Ann. 5, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n631.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who writes out accounts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actum: <entryFree id="n632" type="main" key="actum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. ago.</entryFree>
actuose: <entryFree id="n633" type="main" key="actu^o_se"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭōse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, see the foll. art. <sense id="n633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
actuosus: <entryFree id="n634" type="main" key="actu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>actus</etym>, <sense id="n634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of activity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very active</hi> (with the access. idea of zeal, subjective impulse; diff. from <hi rend="ital">industrius</hi>, which refers more to the means by which an object is attained, Doed. Syn. 1, 123): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus actuosa (est), et deus vester nihil agens expers virtutis (est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 39</bibl>.—Hence, acc. to Fest. s. v. actus, p. 15, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an actor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dancer.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">actŭōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a lively manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with activity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
actus: <entryFree id="n635" type="main" key="actus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from ago.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n636" type="main" key="actus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ago</etym>. <sense id="n636.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The moving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">driving of an object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impulse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motion</hi>: linguae actu, Pacuv. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 506, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis constantior est natura ... et cunctantior actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi admonitu, non actu, inflectit illam feram,</quote> <trans><tr>by driving</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertur in abruptum magno mons inprobus actu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila contorsit violento spiritus actu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 432" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 432</bibl></cit>; hominum aut animalium actu vehiculum adhibemus, Cael. Aurel. Tard. 1, 1.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n636.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n636.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The right of driving cattle through a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a passage for cattle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae ductus, haustus, iter, actus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caec. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Dig. 8, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n636.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A road between fields; a cart-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carriage-way</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:4" default="NO">8, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:19:1 al" default="NO">43, 19, 1 al.</bibl>—And, </sense><sense id="n636.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">piece of land</hi> (in quo boves <hi rend="ital">aguntur</hi>, cum aratur, cum impetu justo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 59</bibl>): actus minimus, 120 <hi rend="ital">feet long and</hi> 4 <hi rend="ital">feet wide</hi>: quadratus, 120 <hi rend="ital">feet square;</hi> and duplicatus, 240 <hi rend="ital">feet long and</hi> 120 <hi rend="ital">feet wide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 34</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 10</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 17</bibl> Müll. Also <hi rend="ital">a division made by bees in a hive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 22</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n636.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The doing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">performing or a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an act</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n636.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (so not in Cic.; for Leg. 1, 11, inst. of pravis actibus, is to be read, pravitatibus; <cit><quote lang="la">but often in the post-Aug. per.): post actum operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vero actu rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorice in actu consistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec residua diurni actus conficeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non consenserat actibus eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:23:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 23, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n636.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n636.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Public employment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">business of state</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">judicial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actus rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>jurisdiction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 15, 23</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> actus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:41 al" default="NO">40, 5, 41 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n636.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The action accompanying oral delivery.</hi> </sense><sense id="n636.10" n="a" level="4"> Of an orator: <cit><quote lang="la">motus est in his orationis et actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140" default="NO">11, 3, 140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n636.11" n="b" level="4"> Of an actor: <hi rend="ital">the representation of a play</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a character</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim histrioni, ut placeat, peragenda est fabula, modo in quocunque fuerit actu, probetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminum actus,</quote> <trans><tr>recital</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrionum actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tragico quodam actu, cum elapsum baculum cito resumpsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl></cit>.—Hence, also, <hi rend="ital">a larger division of a play</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an act</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo actu placeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque minor quinto, nec sit productior actu Fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 189</bibl></cit>, and trop. (in Cic. very often): <cit><quote lang="la">extremus actus aetatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartus actus improbitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12 al.</bibl> <pb n="26" /> <cb n="ACUM" /></sense></entryFree>
actutum: <entryFree id="n637" type="main" key="actu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">actūtum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>“ab actu” (as <hi rend="ital">astutus</hi> from <hi rend="ital">astu;</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">tum</hi> as enclitic, <hi rend="ital">in der Handlung da</hi>, Corss. Ausspr. II. 849), “id est, celeritate,” <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1013</bibl> P.; so Hand, s. v. who explains: <hi rend="ital">uno actu</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nulla re intercedente</hi>; Lindem. de Adv. Lat. Spec. 4, p. 17, regards it as formed from an obs. vb. actuo, with the meaning <hi rend="ital">cum multo actu</hi>, <hi rend="ital">non segniter;</hi> cf.: ait et dicto citius placat, qs. <hi rend="ital">while in the act of speaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 142</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 80</bibl></etym>; <sense id="n637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instantly</hi> (in Plaut. very often, more rarely in Ter., and, except in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 26</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 557</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14, 5</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 13</bibl>, perh. not occurring in the class. per.): ite actutum, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 323, 1</bibl>: aut hic est aut hic adfore actutum autumo, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 237, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">redibo actutum ... id actutum diu est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; and so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cap. 3, 5, 75 al.</bibl>: vos ite actutum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 357, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ph. 5, 6, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">often in late Lat.: si bene aestimo, actutum merebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Et. 1:41" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Et. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:64" default="NO">2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:43" default="NO">3, 43</bibl>; 5, 35.</sense></entryFree>
acuarius: <entryFree id="n638" type="gloss" key="a^cu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. acus</etym>, <sense id="n638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes needles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pins</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acula: <entryFree id="n639" type="main" key="a^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little needle</hi>, acc. to Cledon, p. 1896: <cit><quote lang="la">frigit fricantem corpus acula (lect. dub.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Rib. Trag. Rel. p. 195" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Rib. Trag. Rel. p. 195</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aculeatus: <entryFree id="n640" type="main" key="a^cu_le^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūlĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aculeus</etym>, <sense id="n640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with stings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prickles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prickly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n640.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals and plants: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:22:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bruchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:51:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 51, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:19:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <trans><tr>a puncture made by a sting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n640.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n640.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Stinging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec ... aculeata sunt, animum fodicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n640.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subtle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contorta et aculeata sophismata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aculeo: <entryFree id="n641" type="main" key="A^cu_le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăcūlĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen in the</hi> gens Furia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 55, 4</bibl>.—C. Aculeo, <hi rend="ital">a famous lawyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friend of L. Licinius Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
aculeolus: <entryFree id="n642" type="main" key="a^cu_le^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūlĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>aculeus</etym>, <sense id="n642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little needle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pin</hi>: aculeolos in cochleare tulit, an old reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:71" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 71</bibl>, where now <hi rend="ital">acu levius vix</hi> cochleare, is read.</sense></entryFree>
aculeus: <entryFree id="n643" type="main" key="a^cu_le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūlĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 618</bibl> P. <lbl>dim.</lbl> from 1. acus, with the gender changed, like diecula fr. dies, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:1463" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> 1463</bibl> P.</etym>, <sense id="n643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n643.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n643.2" n="A" level="2"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">apis aculeum sine clamore ferre non possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neparum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15 al.</bibl></cit>—Also, <hi rend="ital">the spur of fowls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locustarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n643.3" n="B" level="2"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">a spine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prickle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carduorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:23:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 23, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n643.4" n="C" level="2"> Of an arrow or dart, <hi rend="ital">the point</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 21, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n643.5" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">a sting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n643.6" n="A" level="2"> Of a sharp, cutting remark: <cit><quote lang="la">pungunt quasi aculeis interrogatiunculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 24 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 42, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n643.7" n="B" level="2"> Of harsh treatment: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeos severitatis judicum evellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 12, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n643.8" n="C" level="2"> Of painful thought or care: <cit><quote lang="la">meum ille pectus pungit aculeus, quid illi negoti fuerit ante aedīs meas, Plant. Trin. 4, 2, 158: domesticarum sollicitudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acumen: <entryFree id="n644" type="main" key="a^cu_me^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūmĕn</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>acuo</etym>, <sense id="n644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a point</hi> to prick or sting with; diff. fr. <hi rend="ital">cacumen</hi>, which designates merely the summit or extremity of a thing, Doed. Syn. 2, 108. </sense><sense id="n644.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tum clupei resonunt et ferri stridit acumen, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 838</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 369 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">coni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1193</bibl></cit> (i.e. <hi rend="ital">the pointed contraction of the nose before death;</hi> cf. Bentl. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 29</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">stili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum Diana volanti abstulerat jaculo: lignum sine acumine venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 353</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 84</bibl>.—Hence, also, <hi rend="ital">the sting of an animal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorpii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=685" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 685</bibl></cit>:—auspicium ex acuminibus, <hi rend="ital">a military omen of victory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when the spears stuck in the ground suddenly begin to burn or shine at the points</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 36, 77</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 13</bibl>.—In Plin., of the taste: <hi rend="ital">sharpness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pungency</hi>, 14, 20, 25.—</sense><sense id="n644.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig., of the mind, like acies. </sense><sense id="n644.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Acuteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewdness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acumen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis leporem, ingeniorum acumen, dicendi copiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 27, 27, § 97</bibl>.—Also without a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi est acumen tuum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; so Lucr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 2</bibl>: Empedocles an Stertinium deliret acumen, Hor. <cb n="ACUO" /> Ep. 1, 12, 20.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> also in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">serus Graecis admovit acumina chartis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n644.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtlety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argutiae et acumen Hyperidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 31</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 63</bibl>.—Also in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialectici ipsi se compungunt suis acuminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricis acumina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 55</bibl></cit>. —Hence,</sense></entryFree>
acuminarius: <entryFree id="n645" type="main" key="a^cu_mi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūmĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>acumen</etym>, <sense id="n645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good for sharpening</hi>: mola, <hi rend="ital">for sharpening weapons</hi>, Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
acumino: <entryFree id="n646" type="main" key="a^cu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sharpen</hi>, in <hi rend="ital">verb finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contextum spinae acuminavit in caudam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum culicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:35:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 24, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
acuo: <entryFree id="n647" type="main" key="a^cu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŭo</orth>, <itype>ui, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> acuturus, not used) [cf. 2. acer], <hi rend="ital">to make sharp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sharpen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n647.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne stridorem quidem serrae audiunt, cum acuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 386</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:32:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 32, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:51:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 51, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 3, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n647.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n647.3" n="A" level="2"> First, of the tongue, qs. <hi rend="ital">to whet</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to sharpen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuere linguam exercitatione dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam causis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:139:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 139, 4</bibl>; so in gen.: se, <hi rend="ital">to exercise one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make one's self ready</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acueram me ad exagitandam hanc ejus legationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: mentem, ingenium, prudentiam, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to sharpen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa, quae acuant mentem, multa quae obtundant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n647.4" n="B" level="2"> Acuere aliquem (with or without ad aliquid), <hi rend="ital">to spur on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad crudelitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos sat aetas acuet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita duae res, quae languorem afferunt ceteris, illum acuebant, otium et solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curis acuens mortalia corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditisque lupos acuunt balatibus agni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam Juno his acuit verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 330</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n647.5" n="C" level="2"> Aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">saevus in armis Aeneas acuit Martem et se suscitat irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 3.—</sense><sense id="n647.6" n="D" level="2"> In gramm.: acuere syllabam, <hi rend="ital">to give an acute accent to</hi> (opp. gravem ponere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Op. Min. 159</bibl> Lind.: accentus acutus ideo inventus est, quod acuat sive elevet syllabam.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharpened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made pointed;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n647.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pointed</hi> (<hi rend="ital">acer</hi> denotes natural sharpness, etc.: <hi rend="ital">acutus</hi>, that produced by exertion, skill, etc.: sermo acer, <hi rend="ital">impassioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionate;</hi> sermo acutus, <hi rend="ital">pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute discourse</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">vide ut sit acutus culter probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 231</bibl></cit>; elementa, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jagged atoms</hi> (opp. to perplexa, connected), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 463</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Cap. 3, 4, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>of a pointed shape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans><tr>pointed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 61</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n647.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n647.9" n="a" level="4"> Of the senses themselves, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos acrīs atque cicutos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n647.10" n="b" level="4"> Of objects affecting the senses, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute;</hi> of the voice, <hi rend="ital">soprano</hi> or <hi rend="ital">treble</hi>: inde loci lituus sonitus effudit acutos, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 522 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hinnitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cir. 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem ab acutissimo sono usque ad gravissimum sonum recipiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>from the highest treble to the lowest base</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 57, 216</bibl>; Somn. Scip. 5; Rep. 6, 18.—</sense><sense id="n647.11" n="c" level="4"> In gen., of things affecting the body, of either heat or cold from their similar effects, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radii solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 93</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (opp. longus), <hi rend="ital">rapid.— Subst.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuta belli,</quote> <trans><tr>violent</tr>, <tr>severe misfortunes of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 76</bibl></cit> (= graves belli molestias).—</sense><sense id="n647.12" n="B" level="2"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n647.13" n="1" level="3"> Of intellectual qualities, <hi rend="ital">acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear-sighted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagacious</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">Antisthenes homo acutus magis quam eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51</bibl>; id. N. D. <cb n="AD" /> 1, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ingenio prudentiāque acutissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutae sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus animorum ad excogitandum acuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gen. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n647.14" n="2" level="3"> In gramm.: accentus acutus, <hi rend="ital">the acute accent</hi> (opp. gravis), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 159</bibl>, ed. Lindem.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sharply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acutely:.</hi> cernere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 804</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 811</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conlecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excogitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 3, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūtum</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resonarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 41</bibl></cit>: and, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcūta</orth>: canis ululat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 9</bibl> Müll.
